ddf.metrics.reporting.internal.rrd4j

Class RrdMetricsRetriever

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.metrics.reporting.internal.rrd4j.RrdMetricsRetriever
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetricsRetriever

    public class RrdMetricsRetriever
extends Object
implements MetricsRetriever
    Retrieves metrics historical data from an RRD file and formats that data in a variety of formats over a specified time range.

    The supported formats include:

    • a PNG graph of the data (returned to the client as a byte array)
    • a CSV file which can be displayed in Microsoft Excel, OpenOffice Calc, etc.
    • a stream in XLS-format, which can be displayed in Microsoft Excel or OpenOffice Calc
    • a stream in PPT-format, which can be displayed in Microsoft PowerPoint or OpenOffice Impress
    • as XML (no schema provided)
    • a JSON-formatted string

    Aggregate reports, which include the data for all metrics, over a specified time range are also supported in XLS (Excel) and PPT (PowerPoint) format. For example, if there are 10 metrics that are having data collected, then an aggregate report in XLS would be a spreadsheet with a separate worksheet for each of the 10 metrics. Similarly, this aggregate report in PPT format would consist of a slide per metric, where each slide contains the metric's graph and total count (if applicable).

    Author:
    rodgersh, ddf.isgs@lmco.com

      • createGraph

        public byte[] createGraph(String metricName,
                          String rrdFilename,
                          long startTime,
                          long endTime)
                   throws IOException,
                          MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the PNG-formatted graph of the metric's data from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. The vertical axis label defaults to the metric's name, and the title for the graph defaults to the metric's name and the time range (e.g., catalogQueries for Apr 10 2013 09:14:43 to Apr 10 2013 09:29:43).
        Specified by:
        createGraph in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricName - name of the metric to be graphed
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        PNG-formatted graph of metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        verticalAxisLabel - label to use for the vertical (y) axis

        Throws:

      • createCsvData

        public String createCsvData(String rrdFilename,
                            long startTime,
                            long endTime)
                     throws IOException,
                            MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the metric's data as a CSV (Comma Separated Values) formatted string from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. This CSV string will consist of the first row being the column headers (namely Timestamp,Value), and the remaining lines will each contain the timestamp and value for a single sample of the metric's data.
        Specified by:
        createCsvData in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        CSV-formatted string of the metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createXmlData

        public String createXmlData(String metricName,
                            String rrdFilename,
                            long startTime,
                            long endTime)
                     throws IOException,
                            MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the metric's data as an XML formatted string from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. No XML schema is defined or referenced in the returned XML. The format of this XML string will be: 
         
 <metricName>
     <title>metricName for startTime to endTime</title>
     <data>
         <sample>
             <timestamp>MMM DD YYY hh:mm:ss</timestamp>
             <value>12345</value>
         </sample>
         <sample>
         ...
         </sample>
         <totalCount>99999</totalCount>
     </data>
 </metricName>
        Note that is only present for metrics that are counters, i.e., values that would always increment and never decrement, e.g., catalogQueries metric.
        Specified by:
        createXmlData in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricName - name of the metric to retrieve data for
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        XML-formatted string of the metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createXlsData

        public OutputStream createXlsData(String metricName,
                                  String rrdFilename,
                                  long startTime,
                                  long endTime)
                           throws IOException,
                                  MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the metric's data as an XLS (Excel spreadsheet) formatted stream from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. This XLS stream will consist of:
        • the first row being the title of the spreadsheet
        • a blank row for spacing/readability
        • column headers (namely Timestamp,Value)
        • the remaining rows will each contain the timestamp and value for a single sample of the metric's data
        • if the metric has a total count, then this will be in the last row of the spreadsheet
        Specified by:
        createXlsData in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricName - name of the metric to retrieve data for
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        XLS-formatted stream of the metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createPptData

        public OutputStream createPptData(String metricName,
                                  String rrdFilename,
                                  long startTime,
                                  long endTime)
                           throws IOException,
                                  MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the metric's data as a PPT (PowerPoint) formatted stream from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. This PPT stream will consist of a single slide containing:
        • a title based on the metric's name
        • a PNG-formatted graph of the metric's data
        • if the metric has a total count, then this will be in the last row of the spreadsheet
        Specified by:
        createPptData in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricName - name of the metric to retrieve data for
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        PPT-formatted stream of the metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createPptReport

        public OutputStream createPptReport(List<String> metricNames,
                                    String metricsDir,
                                    long startTime,
                                    long endTime)
                             throws IOException,
                                    MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Returns a PPT (PowerPoint) formatted stream over the specified time range that contains one slide for each metric. Refer to the createPptData() method for a description of what each slide would contain.
        Specified by:
        createPptReport in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricNames - names of the metrics to retrieve data for
        metricsDir - directory containing all of the metrics' RRD files, typically /data/metrics
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        PPT-formatted stream of all metrics' data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createJsonData

        public String createJsonData(String metricName,
                             String rrdFilename,
                             long startTime,
                             long endTime)
                      throws IOException,
                             MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Retrieves the metric's data as a JSON formatted string from the specified RRD file over the specified time range. The format of this JSON string will be (data values in this sample are notional): 
         
 {
     "title":"catalogQueries for Apr 10 2013 10:18:05 to Apr 10 2013 10:33:05",
     "totalCount":5348,
     "data":[
       {
           "timestamp":"Apr 10 2013 10:18:00",
           "value":351
       },
       {
           "timestamp":"Apr 10 2013 10:19:00",
           "value":358
       },
     ]
 }
        Note that is only present for metrics that are counters, i.e., values that would always increment and never decrement, e.g., catalogQueries metric.
        Specified by:
        createJsonData in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricName - name of the metric to retrieve data for
        rrdFilename - name of the RRD file to retrieve the metric's data from
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        Returns:
        JSON-formatted string of the metric's data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • createXlsReport

        public OutputStream createXlsReport(List<String> metricNames,
                                    String metricsDir,
                                    long startTime,
                                    long endTime,
                                    String summaryInterval)
                             throws IOException,
                                    MetricsGraphException
        Description copied from interface: MetricsRetriever
        Returns an XLS (Excel spreadsheet) formatted stream over the specified time range that contains one worksheet for each metric. Refer to the createXlsData() method for a description of what each worksheet would contain.
        Specified by:
        createXlsReport in interface MetricsRetriever
        Parameters:
        metricNames - names of the metrics to retrieve data for
        metricsDir - directory containing all of the metrics' RRD files, typically /data/metrics
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to retrieve metric's data
        summaryInterval - unit of time to group metrics by
        Returns:
        XLS-formatted stream of all metrics' data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException

      • getMetricData

        public MetricData getMetricData(String rrdFilename,
                                long startTime,
                                long endTime)
                         throws IOException,
                                MetricsGraphException
        Retrieves the RRD stored data for the specified metric over the specified time range.
        Parameters:
        rrdFilename - the name of the RRD file containing the metric's data
        startTime - start time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to fetch metric's data
        endTime - end time, in seconds since Unix epoch, to fetch metric's data
        Returns:
        domain object containing the metric's sampled data, which consists of the timestamps and their associated values, and the total count of the sampled data
        Throws:
        IOException
        MetricsGraphException
